question: Can I increase my mortgage amount if my income has increased to $85,000 annually?
true_answer: Yes, with increased income, your mortgage amount could increase. Consider debt ratio and credit health.

steps.content: Can I increase my mortgage amount if my income has increased to $85,000 annually?
Plan: 1) Verify new eligibility with home_loan_agent. 2) Check credit standing with credit_agent. 3) Recalculate DTI. 4) Supervisor review. 5) Return answer.
Retrieving knowledge on mortgage eligibility with increased income.
Higher income can increase mortgage eligibility if DTI remains below threshold.
Checking credit health to ensure no negative changes.
Credit standing is stable with no recent derogatory marks.
Calculating new debt-to-income ratio with updated income.
New DTI calculated as 28%, keeping it within acceptable limits.
Will this affect my interest rate?
Retrieving impact of increased mortgage on interest rates.
Interest rates depend on market conditions, typically unaffected by income changes alone.
Review complete, all information accurate and verified.
Yes, with increased income, your mortgage amount could increase. Consider debt ratio and credit health.
Interest rates typically remain steady unless market conditions change.
